meanings.definition: A person or thing that squelches.
meanings.sent1: The squelchers in the library kept shushing everyone.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was the squelcher of all noisy disruptions in class.
meanings.sent3: The squelchers at the party were the ones who always quieted down the music.
meanings.sent4: Her stern look acted as a squelcher on any loud conversations.
meanings.sent5: The squelchers in the office were the employees who always hushed any gossip.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that suppresses noise.
meanings.sent1: The squelchers in the headphones helped block out the loud sounds.
meanings.sent2: The soundproof walls acted as effective squelchers in the recording studio.
meanings.sent3: The squelchers in the movie theater made sure the film's sound was crystal clear.
meanings.sent4: The squelchers on the machine reduced the noise to a whisper.
meanings.sent5: The squelchers on the door prevented any outside noise from entering the room.

meanings.definition: A type of footwear designed to protect against wet conditions.
meanings.sent1: She put on her squelchers before stepping out into the rain.
meanings.sent2: The squelchers kept her feet dry and warm during the storm.
meanings.sent3: His bright yellow squelchers added a pop of color to his rainy day outfit.
meanings.sent4: The squelchers were like little raincoats for his feet.
meanings.sent5: The squelchers had special grips to prevent slipping on wet surfaces.
